item.title:
Our new research white paper identifies seven practices for keeping increasingly agentic AI systems safe and accountable as they become more common and more capable.
We are providing research grants for work on a range of open questions. https://openai.com/research/practices-for-governing-agentic-ai-systems
item.content:encoded:
Our new research white paper identifies seven practices for keeping increasingly agentic AI systems safe and accountable as they become more common and more capable.

We are providing research grants for work on a range of open questions. openai.com/research/practice…

item.title:
R to @OpenAI: There is lots of low-hanging fruit and many promising directions for future work. We think this is an exciting opportunity for the ML research community.
To kickstart more research, we're launching $10M in grants: https://x.com/OpenAI/status/1735347884718211562?s=20
item.content:encoded:
There is lots of low-hanging fruit and many promising directions for future work. We think this is an exciting opportunity for the ML research community.

To kickstart more research, we're launching $10M in grants: x.com/OpenAI/status/17353478…

nitter.cz/OpenAI/status/1735347884718211562#m

item.title:
R to @OpenAI: Naive weak supervision isn't enough—current techniques, like RLHF, won't be sufficient for future superhuman models.
But we also show that it's feasible to drastically improve weak-to-strong generalization—making iterative empirical progress on a core challenge of superalignment
item.content:encoded:
Naive weak supervision isn't enough—current techniques, like RLHF, won't be sufficient for future superhuman models.

But we also show that it's feasible to drastically improve weak-to-strong generalization—making iterative empirical progress on a core challenge of superalignment

item.title:
R to @OpenAI: Large pretrained models have excellent raw capabilities—but can we elicit these fully with only weak supervision?
GPT-4 supervised by ~GPT-2 recovers performance close to GPT-3.5 supervised by humans—generalizing to solve even hard problems where the weak supervisor failed!
item.content:encoded:
Large pretrained models have excellent raw capabilities—but can we elicit these fully with only weak supervision?

GPT-4 supervised by ~GPT-2 recovers performance close to GPT-3.5 supervised by humans—generalizing to solve even hard problems where the weak supervisor failed!

item.title:
In the future, humans will need to supervise AI systems much smarter than them.
We study an analogy: small models supervising large models.
Read the Superalignment team's first paper showing progress on a new approach, weak-to-strong generalization: https://openai.com/research/weak-to-strong-generalization
item.content:encoded:
In the future, humans will need to supervise AI systems much smarter than them.

We study an analogy: small models supervising large models.

Read the Superalignment team's first paper showing progress on a new approach, weak-to-strong generalization: openai.com/research/weak-to-…

item.title:
R to @OpenAI: Figuring out how to ensure future superhuman AI systems are aligned and safe is one of the most important unsolved technical problems in the world. But we think it is a solvable problem.
There is lots of low-hanging fruit, and new researchers can make enormous contributions!
item.content:encoded:
Figuring out how to ensure future superhuman AI systems are aligned and safe is one of the most important unsolved technical problems in the world. But we think it is a solvable problem.

There is lots of low-hanging fruit, and new researchers can make enormous contributions!

item.title:
We're announcing, together with @ericschmidt: Superalignment Fast Grants.
$10M in grants for technical research on aligning superhuman AI systems, including weak-to-strong generalization, interpretability, scalable oversight, and more.
Apply by Feb 18! https://openai.com/blog/superalignment-fast-grants
item.content:encoded:
We're announcing, together with @ericschmidt: Superalignment Fast Grants.

$10M in grants for technical research on aligning superhuman AI systems, including weak-to-strong generalization, interpretability, scalable oversight, and more.

Apply by Feb 18! openai.com/blog/superalignme…

item.title:
We have formed a new global partnership with @AxelSpringer and its news products.
Real-time information from @politico, @BusinessInsider, European properties @BILD and @welt, and other publications will soon be available to ChatGPT users.
ChatGPT’s answers to user queries will include attribution and links to full articles for transparency and further information. http://www.openai.com/blog/axel-springer-partnership
item.content:encoded:
We have formed a new global partnership with @AxelSpringer and its news products.

Real-time information from @politico, @BusinessInsider, European properties @BILD and @welt, and other publications will soon be available to ChatGPT users.

ChatGPT’s answers to user queries will include attribution and links to full articles for transparency and further information. openai.com/blog/axel-springe…

item.title:
Our Safety Systems team is on the frontlines of ensuring the safety and reliability of our AI models in the real world today.
Learn about the team’s vision, challenges, and structure and see how you can be part of making AI safer and more beneficial for society. https://openai.com/safety/safety-systems
item.content:encoded:
Our Safety Systems team is on the frontlines of ensuring the safety and reliability of our AI models in the real world today.

Learn about the team’s vision, challenges, and structure and see how you can be part of making AI safer and more beneficial for society. openai.com/safety/safety-sys…

item.title:
ChatGPT is turning 1! 🥳🎂
Today we’re celebrating our users around the world who are doing amazing things.
item.content:encoded:
ChatGPT is turning 1! 🥳🎂

Today we’re celebrating our users around the world who are doing amazing things.

item.title: Sam Altman is back as CEO, Mira Murati as CTO and Greg Brockman as President. OpenAI has a new initial board. Messages from @sama and board chair @btaylor https://openai.com/blog/sam-altman-returns-as-ceo-openai-has-a-new-initial-board
item.content:encoded: Sam Altman is back as CEO, Mira Murati as CTO and Greg Brockman as President. OpenAI has a new initial board. Messages from @sama and board chair @btaylor openai.com/blog/sam-altman-r…

item.title: OpenAI is nothing without its people

We have reached an agreement in principle for Sam Altman to return to OpenAI as CEO with a new initial board of Bret Taylor (Chair), Larry Summers, and Adam D'Angelo.
We are collaborating to figure out the details. Thank you so much for your patience through this.
item.content:encoded:
We have reached an agreement in principle for Sam Altman to return to OpenAI as CEO with a new initial board of Bret Taylor (Chair), Larry Summers, and Adam D'Angelo.

We are collaborating to figure out the details. Thank you so much for your patience through this.

item.title:
ChatGPT with voice is now available to all free users. Download the app on your phone and tap the headphones icon to start a conversation.
Sound on 🔊
item.content:encoded:
ChatGPT with voice is now available to all free users. Download the app on your phone and tap the headphones icon to start a conversation.

Sound on 🔊

item.title: Our OpenAI DevDay Breakout Sessions are now live on YouTube. Check out deeper dives of our new features for developers, techniques for maximizing LLM performance, and more. https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLOXw6I10VTv-exVCRuRjbT6bqkfO74rWz
